metadata.title: CVE-2024-46737 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvmet-tcp: fix kernel crash if commands allocation failsIf the commands allocation fails in nvmet_tcp_alloc_cmds()the kernel crashes in nvmet_tcp_release_queue_work() because ofa NULL pointer dereference.  nvmet: failed to install queue 0 cntlid 1 ret 6  Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at         virtual address 0000000000000008Fix the bug by setting queue->nr_cmds to zero in casenvmet_tcp_alloc_cmd() fails.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
